meanings.definition: In a manner that is very numerous or vast in quantity.
meanings.sent1: The stars shone multitudinously in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The flowers bloomed multitudinously in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The ants marched multitudinously towards the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The rain fell multitudinously, flooding the streets.
meanings.sent5: The balloons filled the room multitudinously, creating a colorful spectacle.

meanings.definition: Having a large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The multitudinously crowded room buzzed with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The shelves were filled multitudinously with books of all genres.
meanings.sent3: The multitudinously decorated cake was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The multitudinously populated city never slept.
meanings.sent5: The multitudinously attended concert was a huge success.
